function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Global wastewater temperature modeling can help in predicting the impact of temperature on the degradation of biomarkers in wastewater, providing a basis for informed decision-making in public health responses.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for prolonged virus survival in sewer lines due to temperature changes","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Underestimation of covid-19 prevalence due to seasonal temperature changes and wastewater temperatures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of stable case load due to temperature changes not being accounted for","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Changing population focus for wastewater-based epidemiology wbe observations due to seasonal temperature changes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Seasonal weather conditions influencing the persistence of sars-cov-2 in sewer systems","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations of wastewater sampling in reflecting the health status of the population","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Practicability and cost considerations of clinical testing and wastewater-based epidemiology wbe","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate testing capacity for a nation’s population may lead to slow and incomplete assessment of infection status, allowing for undetected spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High cost of individual clinical testing for large populations may limit the frequency and scope of testing, leading to delayed or incomplete identification of infected individuals.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited clinical testing capacity compared to population size may result in slow and costly screening processes, hindering effective assessment and management of contagious disease spread.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate detection limit and precision of quantitative data","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Logistical challenges and costs of wbe approach","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to wbe for certain regions and populations","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Large sample volumes and effective concentration of virus particles may lower method detection limits.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Desire to keep required sample sizes low for economic shipping.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in obtaining data on the infectivity of sewage-borne sars-cov-2.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need for a study on the decay and detectability of sars-cov-2 as a function of temperature.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Wastewater-based epidemiology wbe may not fully replace clinical testing for covid-19 and may need to be used in conjunction with clinical testing.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limitations in global access to centrally collected wastewater for wbe may restrict its effectiveness in certain regions.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Diverting resources from clinical testing to wbe may affect the accuracy and timeliness of covid-19 surveillance and response.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Financial interests in startup companies related to the study’s intellectual space","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Founding a nonprofit project providing wastewater-based health assessments","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Disintegrated and non-interoperable data inhibits computer-assisted reasoning, hindering artificial intelligence.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of bioinformatics tools hinders integration and analysis of heterogeneous data and knowledge.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on ontologies for data standardization and knowledge representation poses a single point of failure risk.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Propagation of contagious diseases through data sharing and integration","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of biomedical ontologies for studying coronavirus diseases","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of interoperability between ontologies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to align terms under basic formal ontology bfo","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate representation of coronavirus infectious diseases in cido","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interoperability with over 300 other ontologies increases the risk of propagating inaccuracies and inconsistencies in disease data.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Development of cido-specific terms for covid-19 and other coronavirus diseases may lead to discrepancies in terminology and classification with existing ontologies.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Logical axioms and relations within the ontology may introduce errors or biases in representing disease processes and causation.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Infection with sars-cov-2 leading to the development of covid-19","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Identification of drugs with potential anti-coronavirus effects","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of ontology-based integration and analysis of anti-coronavirus drugs","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unregulated promotion of drugs based on information extracted from ontologies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incomplete coverage of drug information in existing ontologies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient representation of vaccine information in ontologies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of misinformation due to incomplete ontology-based approaches","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to community-based metadata standardization for clinical and experimental studies.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Historical pandemics recurring every 30 to 40 years","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of pandemics on the design of buildings and cities","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Introduction of quarantine facilities and sanitation policies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fast and unstoppable disease transmission due to high human mobility","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overload of hospitals and quarantine facilities","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changing living styles and uncertain conditions leading to the need for infectious disease-friendly building designs","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Historically, pandemics have always had an impact on architecture.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Human fear of infectious diseases has led to the emergence of artificial environments.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"}]}
